title: Filesystem permissions depends on ordering of permission sets
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (f460583 2023-12-08T11:40:00.032248000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

_No response_

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

Depending on the order in which the permissions are set in the `fs_permissions` array of `foundry.toml` impacts the permissions that are being set. For example setting the root to have read only permissions and the `./cache` folder to have write only permissions will fail if the read only permission for root are set first.

``` bash
// foundry.toml
...
fs_permissions = [{ access = "read", path = "./"}, { access = "write", path = "./cache"}]
```

``` javascript
// Test.t.sol
...
function test_read_write() public {
    vm.readFile("foundry.toml");
    vm.writeFile("./cache/cachedFile.txt", "cached data");
}

// [FAIL. Reason: the path cache/cachedFile.json is not allowed to be accessed for write operations]
```

Reversing the order of the `fs_permissions` will not fail, implying that the ordering is important. I did not notice anything mentioning this in the docs, so I assume it's unintended .

``` bash
// foundry.toml
...
fs_permissions = [{ access = "write", path = "./cache"}, { access = "read", path = "./"}]
```
